group.name: view
group.string: Click to choose the interface theme.

group.name: project
group.string: General settings for the entire project.
The name or organisation of the author of the project.
A sentence or two describing the project.
A number to identify the version of the project.
The layout that will initially load when the project is run.
If on, objects are always drawn at integer positions. If off, objects can be drawn between pixels.
The size of the window area at runtime, in pixels.
The width of the window area at runtime, in pixels.
The height of the window area at runtime, in pixels.
Settings specific to the active configuration.
Launch help for information about project properties.

group.name: layout
group.string: Choose the event sheet to run for this layout. You can include other event sheets from this sheet.
The layer new objects are inserted to.
Allow scrolling past the layout edges.
The size of the layout area, in pixels.
The width of the layout, in pixels.
The height of the layout, in pixels.
The size of free space outside the layout, in pixels.
The horizontal margin size, in pixels.
The vertical margin size, in pixels.
Shortcut to view properties for this layout's project.
Launch help for information about layout properties.

group.name: layer
group.string: Show the layer when the layout starts at runtime.
The background color of the layer, if not transparent.
Ignore the background color and have a transparent background.
The overall layer opacity, from 0 (transparent) to 100 (opaque).
Force the layer to render to an intermediate texture even when no effects are used. Rendering is faster with this set to 'no'.
The rate the layer scales as the scale changes (use 0 to disable scaling).
The rate at which the layer scrolls in each direction, as percentages.
The horizontal scroll rate as a percentage (e.g. 50 for half speed).
The vertical scroll rate as a percentage (e.g. 50 for half speed).
Settings for the selected layer which only affect how it is used in the editor.
Show the layer in the editor's layout view.
Prevent any objects on this layer being selected or changed.
Scroll the layer according to its parallax setting in the editor.
Launch help for information about layer properties.

group.name: objectclass
group.string: Settings for the selected object type.
The name of this type of object.
The plugin type of this object.
Global objects are not destroyed at the end of a layout.
Variables stored in each instance of an object.
Instance variables inherited by all the objects in this family.
A {0} instance variable, unique to each instance of the object.
Click to add, change or remove instance variables.
Launch help for more information on these properties.

group.name: instance
group.string: Layer this object instance is currently on.
The co-ordinates in the layout where this object instance is located, in pixels.
X co-ordinate of this instance in the layout, in pixels.
Y co-ordinate of this instance in the layout, in pixels.
The width and height of this object instance, in pixels.
Width of this instance, in pixels.
Height of this instance, in pixels.
The angle of this instance, in degrees.
The opacity of this instance, from 0 (transparent) to 100 (opaque).
Click to add, change or remove behaviors.
Launch help for more information on these properties.

group.name: animation
group.string: The animation speed, in animation frames per second. This cannot be greater than the game framerate (usually 60).
The number of times to repeat the animation, if not looping.
The frame number to go to when the animation ends.
Launch help for more information about animation properties.
Settings for the selected animation frame.
Relative time to spend on this frame (1 for normal, 2 for twice as long, etc).

group.name: event
group.string: Double-click an object to create a condition from:
Double-click an object to create a replacement condition from:
Double-click an object to create an action from:
Double-click an object to create a replacement action from:

group.name: misc
group.string: Please close the image editor first.
Failed to save a backup to '{0}'. Please check the backup folder can be accessed.

group.name: events
group.string: = Equal to|≠ Not equal to|< Less than|≤ Less or equal|> Greater than|≥ Greater or equal
To start adding events, right-click, double click, or click 'Add event'.
Events are run from top to bottom once per tick (i.e. at the framerate).
Right-click and select 'Help' for more information.

group.name: alerts
save
group.string: What would you like to do?
Save changes\nSave the project to disk, then close.

A license file for Construct 2 was found, but there was an error loading it. Construct 2 has reverted to Free edition.\n\nThis can occur if the file is damaged, corrupted or otherwise modified in any way. If you have a backup of your license file, try restoring it. Otherwise, please contact licensehelp@scirra.com and we'll try to sort you out as quickly as we can.
Balloon tips appear to be disabled! You may not see notifications of errors.
Failed to find or load any exporters. The IDE cannot start up.

group.name: update
group.string: Would you like Construct 2 to automatically check for updates online?
No personal information is sent to Scirra. You may see a warning about Construct 2 attempting to access the Internet.
Check for beta updates\nHelp test new versions of Construct 2. Beta releases introduce new features sooner, but are more likely to have problems.

Construct 2 will not check for updates. Be sure to check the Scirra.com website regularly for updates which may include new features and bug fixes. You can change your update setting in the Preferences dialog.

group.name: gfxdriver
group.string: The driver for your graphics card ({0}) appears to be over 2 years old.
Old drivers can cause crashes and glitches in Construct 2. It is strongly recommended that you check for an updated version of your driver to make sure it does not cause problems in Construct 2.
Take me to a web site which can help me update my driver\nThis is strongly recommended to ensure the best possible experience while using Construct 2.
Ignore this message\nGo back to Construct 2 without checking for a driver update (not recommended). You may experience crashes or glitches caused by your graphics card driver.
Would you like to be taken to a web site which can help you update your driver?

group.name: html5
group.string: Exports to HTML5 based on canvas/javascript that can run in web browsers and be embedded to web pages.

group.name: properties
group.string: Choose the browser to launch when previewing. You must install each browser first!
Choose between http:// or file:// protocols for preview. Not all features work in File mode, so HTTP is recommended.
Resize the canvas to fill the entire browser window.
Enable the WebGL renderer when supported. This usually improves performance.
The resize quality for images resized larger or smaller. (Where supported.)
Set to 'no' to improve performance when background is covered up by objects.

group.name: categories
group.string: Publish to stream (when logged in with permission)

group.name: cnds
group.string: Compare the X co-ordinate to a value.
How to compare the X co-ordinate.
The X co-ordinate to compare to.
Compare the Y co-ordinate to a value.
How to compare the Y co-ordinate.
The Y co-ordinate to compare to.
Test if the object is currently in the visible screen.
Test if the object is outside the layout boundary.
Pick the instance nearest to or furthest from a point in the layout.
Choose whether to pick the nearest or furthest instance to the point.
X co-ordinate of position to compare distance to.
Y co-ordinate of position to compare distance to.
Compare the width to a value.
Compare the height to a value.
Compare if the object's angle is within X degrees of another angle.
Number of degrees that object must be within.
Angle, in degrees, to compare if object facing towards.
Compare if the object's angle is clockwise from another angle.
Angle, in degrees, to test if object's angle is clockwise from.
Compare if the object's angle is between two angles.
First angle, in degrees. Specify in clockwise order.
Second angle, in degrees. Specify in clockwise order.
Compare the value of an instance variable.
Choose the instance variable to compare.
How to compare the instance variable.
Value to compare to the instance variable.
Test if a boolean instance variable is true.
Choose the instance variable to test.
Pick a specific instance by its unique ID (UID).
The unique ID (UID) of the instance to pick.
Test if the object is currently visible.
How to compare the X co-ordinate.
Pick all objects on a given layer.
Layer name or number to test if the object is on.
Pick either the top-most or bottom-most object in Z order.
Choose whether to pick the top-most or bottom-most instance in Z order.

group.name: acts
group.string: Set the object's X and Y co-ordinates at the same time.
Position object relative to another object.
The name or number of an image point in the object to position by. Leave 0 for object's origin.
Move object forwards a number of pixels at its current angle.
Distance, in pixels, to move the object forwards at its current angle.
Move object a number of pixels at a given angle.
Angle, in degrees, at which to move the object.
Distance, in pixels, to move the object at the given angle.
Set the object's width and height at the same time.
Set the angle the object is oriented at.
Rotate the object's angle clockwise by a number of degrees.
Number of degrees to rotate the object clockwise.
Rotate the object's angle counter-clockwise by a number of degrees.
Number of degrees to rotate the object counter-clockwise.
Rotate the object towards another angle.
Number of degrees to rotate towards the target angle.
Angle, in degrees, to rotate towards.
Rotate the object towards a position.
Number of degrees to rotate towards the target position.
Set the object's angle towards a position.
X position to set angle toward.
Y position to set angle toward.
Set the value of an instance variable.
Choose the instance variable to change.
Value to store in this instance variable.
Add to the value of an instance variable.
Choose the instance variable to change.
Value to add to this instance variable.
Subtract from the value of an instance variable.
Choose the instance variable to change.
Value to subtract from this instance variable.
Set the value of a boolean instance variable.
Choose the instance variable to change.
Value to store in this instance variable.
Invert the value of a boolean instance variable.
Choose the instance variable to toggle.
Set whether the object is hidden or shown.
Choose whether the object is hidden or shown.
Set how transparent the object appears.
Choose the object opacity, from 0 (transparent) to 100 (opaque).
Place the object at the top of its layer.
Place the object at the bottom of its layer.
Layer name or number to move this object to. The object will be placed at the top of this layer.

group.name: exps
group.string: Get the object's X co-ordinate, in pixels.
Get the object's Y co-ordinate, in pixels.
Get delta-time for this object (in case it has its own timescale).
Get the object's width, in pixels.
Get the object's height, in pixels.
Get the object's current angle, in degrees.
Get the object's current opacity, from 0 (transparent) to 100 (opaque).
Get the number of instances of this object type.
Get the layer number this object is on.
Get the name of the layer this object is on.
Get the Z index of this object on its current layer.

group.name: cnds
group.string: Run the actions once every tick, a.k.a. 'Always'.
Triggered at the start of the current layout.
Triggered at the end of the current layout.
Make a continuously true event trigger once only, when it first becomes true. Place as the last condition.
Run the actions at a regular time interval.
Specify time, in seconds, between running the actions. Interval is limited by the framerate (actions will not run more than once per tick).
Compare the current time (seconds since startup)
Choose the way to compare the current time.
The time (seconds since starting) to compare to.
Compare two arbitrary values. This condition does not pick any objects.
Enter the first value to compare. This condition does not pick any objects - it is a simple value comparison.
Select the way to compare the values.
Enter the second value to compare. This condition does not pick any objects - it is a simple value comparison.
Test if a layer is currently visible.
Name or number of layer to check visibility for.
Compare the opacity of a layer.
Name or number of layer to compare opacity.
Select the way to compare the layer opacity.
The opacity to compare to, from 0 (transparent) to 100 (opaque).
Repeat actions with an index variable.
Choose the name of the loop. This can be an empty string.
Start index of the loop range (inclusive).
End index of the loop range (inclusive).
Repeat actions once for each instance of an object.
Choose the object for the loop. The actions will repeat once for each instance of the object.
Repeat actions a certain number of times.
Number of times to repeat the actions.
Pick just the nth instance from the currently picked instances of an object.
Choose the object to pick an instance from.
Index of the instance to pick (0-based).
Pick a single random instance from the currently picked instances of an object.
Choose the object to pick a random instance from.
Compare the value of a global or local variable.
Value to compare to the variable.
Test if an event group is currently active.
The name of the event group to test if active.
True if the project is running as a preview rather than as an exported project.
Reset the picked instances to select all of them again.
Choose the object to reset to pick all instances.
True if being viewed on a mobile device. This is an estimate and may not be perfectly accurate.

group.name: acts
group.string: Jump to another layout in the project.
Choose the layout to go to.
Create a new instance of an object in the current layout.
Choose the object type of the new instance to create.
Name or number of the layer to create the instance on.
X co-ordinate at which to place the created instance.
Y co-ordinate at which to place the created instance.
Set the visiblity of a layer.
Name or number of the layer to set visible.
Choose whether the layer is drawn or not.
X co-ordinate to scroll to, in pixels.
Y co-ordinate to scroll to, in pixels.
X co-ordinate to scroll to, in pixels.
Y co-ordinate to scroll to, in pixels.
Set the value of a global or local variable.
Value to store in this variable.
Add to the value of a global or local variable.
Value to add to this variable.
Subtract from the value of a global or local variable.
Value to subtract from this variable.
Activate or deactivate an event group.
The name of the event group to set active.
Choose whether to activate or deactivate the group.
Change the rate time passes in the game, for slow-motion or pause effects.
The new time scale: 1.0 = normal speed, 0.5 = half speed, 2.0 = double speed, 0 = pause, etc.
Change the rate time passes for a specific object. Overrides the game time scale.
The object to change timescale for.
The new time scale for the object (1.0 = normal speed, 0.5 = half speed, etc).
Restore an object's time scale back to game time.
The object to restore timescale for.
Wait a number of seconds before running the next action.
The number of seconds to wait before running the next action.
Set an individual layer's scale (or 'zoom') to make it appear larger or smaller.
Name or number of the layer to set the scale for.
The layer scale (or 'zoom'). 1.0 for original size, 2.0 for double size, etc.
Name or number of the layer to set opacity for.
Set an individual layer's scale rate.
Name or number of the layer to set the scale rate for.
The scale rate to set. 1.0 for ordinary zoom, 2.0 for twice as much zoom, 0 for no zoom etc.
Set the scale of the entire layout.
The overall scale of the layout. 1.0 for original size, 2.0 for double size, etc.
Reset all global variables in the project to their initial values.
Set the angle of the entire layout.
The angle to rotate the canvas view to, in degrees.
Name or number of the layer to set the angle for.
The angle to rotate the layer to, in degrees.
Stop any currently running loop (for, for each, repeat).
Jump to another layout in the project, using a string for the layout name.
The name of the layout to go to.

group.name: exps
group.string: Convert a string or float to an integer.
Convert a string or integer to a float.
Convert an integer or float to a string. You can also use the & operator for concatenation.
Get the number of characters in a text string.
Generate a random number. Pass two numbers to generate within a range.
Range of random numbers to generate, from 0 to one less than this value.
Calculate square root of a number.
Number to take square root of
Calculate absolute (positive) value of a number.
Number to determine absolute (positive) value for.
Round number to the nearest integer.
Number to round to nearest integer.
Round number down to an integer.
Number to round down to integer.
Round number up to an integer.
Number to round up to integer.
Calculate sine of a number (in degrees).
Calculate cosine of a number (in degrees).
Calculate tangent of a number (in degrees).
Calculate arcsine of a number (in degrees).
Calculate arccosine of a number (in degrees).
Calculate arctangent of a number (in degrees).
Calculate e raised to the power of a number.
Number to raise e to the power.
Calculate logarithm to base e of a number.
Number to calculate natural logarithm of.
Calculate logarithm to base 10 of a number.
Calculate maximum of a set of numbers.
Calculate minimum of a set of numbers.
Retrieve the time, in seconds, since the last tick (a.k.a. time delta)
Time in seconds since the game began, taking in to account the time scale.
Retrieve the number of ticks elapsed since the start of the application.
Retrieve the total number of objects in the application.
Retrieve the current frames per second rate.
Retrieve the index of a currently running loop.
Calculate the distance between two points.
Calculate the angle, in degrees, between two points.
X co-ordinate of current scroll location.
Y co-ordinate of current scroll location.
A text string with a line break.
Linearly interpolate a to b by x.
Real-world time in seconds since the game began (i.e. not affected by the time scale).
Return x if between two numbers, else the upper or lower bound.
Get the current scale of a layer (by name or number).
Find the index a string occurs inside another string.
Return the first N characters of a string.
Number of characters at beginning of string to return.
Return the last N characters of a string.
Number of characters at end of string to return.
Return N characters starting at an index in a string.
Index at which to start substring.
Return the Nth token from a string.
Text to get a token from.
0-based index of the token to get.
Character or string to separate tokens.
Return the number of tokens in a string.
Character or string to separate tokens.
Replace all instances of a string within a string.
Text to replace search string with.
Remove whitespace from the beginning and end of a string.
Get the current opacity of a layer (by name or number).
Get the current scale rate of a layer (by name or number).
Layer to get scale rate for.
Get the current scale of the entire layout.
Get the name of the current layout.
Get a string describing the renderer (returns "canvas2d" or "webgl").
Get the smallest difference between two angles in degrees.
Randomly choose one of the parameters.
A random value to choose from.
Another random value to choose from.
Generate an RGB value (number representing a color).
Get the current angle of the layout, in degrees.
Get the current angle of a layer in degrees (by name or number).
Return the version from project properties.
Linearly interpolate angles a to b (in degrees) by x.

group.name: AJAX
group.string: Request and receive other web pages. Note: most browsers don't execute requests locally (in preview mode).

group.name: cnds
group.string: Triggered when an AJAX request completes successfully.
A tag, which can be anything you like, to distinguish between different AJAX requests.
Triggered when an AJAX request fails.
A tag, which can be anything you like, to distinguish between different AJAX requests.

group.name: acts
group.string: Request a URL and retrieve its contents.
A tag, which can be anything you like, to distinguish between different AJAX requests.
The URL to request. Note: most browsers prevent cross-domain requests.

group.name: exps
group.string: Get the data returned by the last successful request.

group.name: Arr
group.string: Store an array of values in up to 3 dimensions.

group.name: properties
group.string: Initial number of elements on the X axis.
Initial number of elements on the Y axis.
Initial number of elements on the Z axis.

group.name: cnds
group.string: Compare the value at an X position (1D) in the array.
X index (0-based) of array value to compare.
The value to compare the array value to.
Compare the value at an X,Y position (2D) in the array.
X index (0-based) of array value to compare.
Y index (0-based) of array value to compare.
The value to compare the array value to.
Compare the value at an X,Y,Z position (3D) in the array.
X index (0-based) of array value to compare.
Y index (0-based) of array value to compare.
Z index (0-based) of array value to compare.
The value to compare the array value to.
Repeat the event for each element in the array.
Select which dimensions to iterate. For example, if you have a 3D array, but only want to iterate in 2D, choose 'XY'.
Compare the value of the current element in a for-each loop.
How to compare the current value in the for-each loop.
The value to compare the array value to.

group.name: acts
group.string: Set the number of elements on each axis of the array.
The new number of elements on the X axis.
The new number of elements on the Y axis.
The new number of elements on the Z axis.
Set the value at an X position (1D) in the array.
The X index (0-based) of the array value to set.
The value to store in the array.
Set the value at an X,Y position (2D) in the array.
The X index (0-based) of the array value to set.
The Y index (0-based) of the array value to set.
The value to store in the array.
Set the value at an X,Y,Z position (3D) in the array.
The X index (0-based) of the array value to set.
The Y index (0-based) of the array value to set.
The Z index (0-based) of the array value to set.
The value to store in the array.

group.name: exps
group.string: Get value from the array. Add second or third parameters to specify Y and Z indices.
The X index (0-based) of the array value to get.
Get the number of elements on the X axis of the array.
Get the number of elements on the Y axis of the array.
Get the number of elements on the Z axis of the array.
Get the current X index in a For Each loop.
Get the current Y index in a For Each loop.
Get the current Z index in a For Each loop.
Get the current value in a For Each loop.

group.name: Audio
group.string: Play sound effects and music from files you've imported to Construct 2.

group.name: properties
group.string: Choose whether the audio playback rate changes with the time scale.

group.name: cnds
group.string: Triggered when an audio file finishes playing.
The audio tag of the file to detect finishing.

group.name: acts
group.string: Choose the audio file to play.
Whether or not to initially play the sound in a loop (repeating).
A tag, which can be anything you like, to use to reference this sound in future.
Enable or disable looping on a sound.
The tag identifying the sound to loop. Leave empty to affect the last played sound.
Choose whether to turn looping on or off.
Mute (make silent) or unmute a sound.
The tag identifying the sound to loop. Leave empty to affect the last played sound.
Choose whether to mute or unmute the sound.
Set the volume (loudness) of a sound.
The tag identifying the sound to loop. Leave empty to affect the last played sound.
The attenuation in decibels (dB). 0 is original volume, -10 dB is about half as loud, etc.
Download an audio file from the server without playing it. This ensures it will play immediately.
Choose the audio file to preload. It will be downloaded from the server but not played.
Set the speed at which a sound plays at.
The tag identifying the sound to loop. Leave empty to affect the last played sound.
The rate of playback. 1.0 is normal speed, 0.5 half speed, 2.0 double speed, etc.
The tag identifying the sound to stop. Leave empty to affect the last played sound.
Play an audio file using a string for the filename.
Choose the folder which contains the audio file.
A string with the name of the audio file to play, without the file extension. For example, to play myfile.ogg, use only "myfile".
Whether or not to initially play the sound in a loop (repeating).
A tag, which can be anything you like, to use to reference this sound in future.

group.name: Browser
group.string: Access the browser that is running the HTML5 application.

group.name: cnds
group.string: Browser is online (i.e. not in an offline browsing mode).
Triggered when user is offline and a connection becomes available.
Triggered when user is online and the connection becomes unavailable.
True when the browser is running from the offline cache, but downloading an update in the background.
Triggered when an update has finished downloading. You may want to prompt the user to reload the page.
True if the page is currently visible to the user, otherwise false (e.g. if in an inactive tab).
Triggers when the page becomes visible (e.g. user switches to the page's tab).
Triggers when the page becomes hidden (e.g. user switches to a different tab).
True if the page is currently in fullscreen mode.

group.name: acts
group.string: Pop up a message box with a message and an OK button.
Enter the message to display in the alert.
Close the current browser window or tab. The browser may prompt the user to confirm.
Focus the current browser window or tab.
Blur (unfocus) the current browser window or tab.
Go to the previous page in browser history.
Go to the next page in browser history.
Enter the full URL to navigate to.
Go to {0} in a new window ([i]{1}[/i])
Open a new window and navigate to a URL.
Enter the full URL to navigate to.
A string to identify this window. You can reuse an existing window by reusing its tag.
Reload the current page. Also updates if an 'On update ready' event has triggered.
Request the user to enter fullscreen mode.

group.name: exps
group.string: Get the current protocol, e.g. http:.
Get the current domain, e.g. scirra.com.
Get the path relative to domain.
Get the hash from the URL, e.g. #myAnchor.
Get the referrer (the page that linked to this page).
Get the browser platform (e.g. Windows, Mac).
Get the browser product name (e.g. Gecko).
Get the full browser user agent string.
Get the full query string, including the ?.
Get a query string parameter by name.

group.name: properties
group.string: The initial text for the text box.
Display this text when hovering the mouse over the control.
Choose whether the text box is visible on startup.
Choose whether the text box is enabled or disabled on startup.

group.name: cnds
group.string: Triggered when the button is clicked.

group.name: acts
group.string: The text to set in the button.
The tooltip to set on the button.
Choose whether to hide or show the button.
Choose whether to enable or disable the button.
Set the input focus to the button.

group.name: properties
group.string: The App ID Facebook gives you after creating an app.
The App Secret Facebook gives you after creating an app. Only necessary for submitting scores!

group.name: cnds
group.string: True when the Facebook API has loaded and is ready to be used.
True if currently being viewed inside Facebook by a logged in user.
Triggered when the user successfully logs in.
Triggered when the user logs out.
Triggered after login when the user's name becomes available.
Triggered after the 'request user top score' action.
Triggered for each top score after the 'request hi-score board' action.
Triggered when the 'publish score' action completes.

group.name: acts
group.string: Log the user in to the application so their details can be accessed.
Ask user for permission to automatically (without prompting) publish to the user's stream. Do not ask for permissions you don't need!
Ask user for permission to publish scores for the user. The App Secret is required to post scores. Do not enter the App Secret if you are not using scores.
Bring up a dialog where the user can share some text on their wall or choose to cancel.
Bring up a dialog where the user can share a link to the app on their wall or choose to cancel.
The name of the app that will appear in the Share dialog.
The caption appearing beneath the name in the Share dialog.
The description appearing beneath the caption in the Share dialog.
The URL of an image on your server to use on the Share dialog. Must include the http://. Defaults to the exported logo.png.
Bring up a dialog where the user can share a link on their wall or choose to cancel.
The link text that will appear in the Share dialog.
The caption appearing beneath the link text in the Share dialog.
The description appearing beneath the caption in the Share dialog.
The URL of an image on your server to use on the Share dialog. Must include the http://
Publish a message to the user's wall. The user should explicitly initiate this.
The text to publish to the user's feed. It is recommended to only do this when the user initiates the action.
Publish a link to the user's wall. The user should explicitly initiate this.
The text to publish to the user's feed. It is recommended to only do this when the user initiates the action.
The caption appearing beneath the link text.
The description appearing beneath the caption.
The URL of an image on your server to use on the Share dialog. Must include the http://
Publish a score for this user.
The user's score for this game to publish.
Request the user's top score, triggering 'on user top score available' when received.
Request the app's hi-score board, triggering 'on hi-score' for each hi-score received.
The number of hi-scores to retrieve.

group.name: exps
group.string: Get the user's full name, if they are logged in.
Get the user's first name, if they are logged in.
Get the user's last name, if they are logged in.
Get the score, when in a 'on user top score' or 'on hi-score' event.
Get the name of the user with hi-score, when in an 'on hi-score' event.
Get the rank of the hi-score, when in an 'on hi-score' event.
Get the user's ID, which is different even for users with the same name.

group.name: cnds
group.string: Triggered when a keyboard key is pressed.
Choose a key. Note that international users and users on different operating systems or devices may not have the same keys available.
Triggered when any keyboard key is pressed.
Test if a keyboard key is currently held down.
Choose a key. Note that international users and users on different operating systems or devices may not have the same keys available.
Triggered when a keyboard key is released.
Choose a key. Note that international users and users on different operating systems or devices may not have the same keys available.

group.name: Kongregate

group.name: cnds
group.string: True if the user is a guest (not logged in).

group.string: Show a dialog prompting the user to register an account.
Submit a statistic to the Kongregate statistics system.
The name of the statistic. Must be created for the game via the Kongregate site first.
The value to submit for the statistic. Must be a positive integer.
Allow the user to post a shout on their profile page. User must be logged in.
Text to add to the shout box.
Show a dialog prompting the user to sign in.

group.name: exps
group.string: Return the current user's ID, or 0 if guest.

(none)|Additive|XOR|Copy|Destination over|Source in|Destination in|Source out|Destination out|Source atop|Destination atop

Maximum random angle deflection in degrees per second.
Maximum random speed adjustment per second, in pixels per second per second.
Maximum random opacity adjustment per second.
Choose when each individual particle is destroyed.
Time in seconds for timeout or fade to invisible (depending on destroy mode).

group.name: Sprite
group.string: An animated object that is the building block of most projects.

group.name: properties
group.string: Click to edit the object's animations.
Click to set the object to the same size as its image.
Choose whether the object is visible when the layout starts.
Choose an effect for this object. (This does not preview in the layout, only when you run.)
(none)|Additive|XOR|Copy|Destination over|Source in|Destination in|Source out|Destination out|Source atop|Destination atop

group.name: cnds
group.string: Triggered when the object collides with another object.
Select the object to test for a collision with.
Test if the object is overlapping another object.
Select the object to test for overlap with.
Test which of the object's animations is currently playing.
Enter the name of the animation to check if playing.
Test which animation frame is currently showing.
How to compare the current animation frame number (0-based).
The animation frame number to compare to (0-based).
Triggered when an animation has finished.
Enter the name of the animation that has finished.
Triggered when any animation has finished.
Triggered when the current animation frame changes.
True if the object has been mirrored with the 'Set Mirrored' action.
True if the object has been flipped with the 'Set Flipped' action.

group.name: acts
group.string: Create another object at this object.
Choose the object type of the new instance to create.
The layer name or number to create the instance on.
Use 0 for the object's origin, or the name or number of an image point to spawn the object from.
Set the rendering effect of this object.
Choose the new effect for this object.
Stop the current animation from playing.
Start the current animation, if it was stopped.
Choose whether to resume or rewind the animation back to the first frame.
The name of the animation to set.
Choose whether to play from the same frame number or rewind the animation back to the first frame.
Set the current animation frame number.
The animation frame number to set (0-based).
The new animation speed, in animation frames per second.
Set the object horizontally mirrored or back to normal.
Choose whether to horizontally mirror the object or set it back to normal.
Set the object vertically flipped or back to normal.
Choose whether to vertically flip the object or set it back to normal.

group.name: exps

The name of the current animation.

The X position of one of the object's image points.
Name or number of image point to get.
The Y position of one of the object's image points.
Name or number of image point to get.
The width of the current animation frame image, in pixels.
The height of the current animation frame image, in pixels.

group.name: properties
group.string: Choose whether the object is visible when the layout starts.
Choose the font to display. This applies to all instances of this type.
Choose the location of the hot spot in the object.
Wrap text by space-separated words or nearest character.

group.name: cnds
group.string: Compare the text in this object.
Enter the text to compare with the object's content.
Choose whether capital letters count as different to lowercase. If ignoring case, "ABC" matches "abc".

group.name: acts
group.string: Set the text of this object.
Enter the text to set the object's content to.
Add text to the end of the existing text.
Enter the text to append to the object's content.
Set the font face used to display text.
The new font face name to set.
Choose the style for the given font face.
The new font color, in the form rgb(r, g, b).
Set the font face from an online web font.
Enter the web URL to the CSS file referencing the web font.

group.name: exps
group.string: Get the current font face name.
Get the current font face size (pt).
Get the width extent of the text in the object in pixels.
Get the height extent of the text in the object in pixels.

group.name: TextBox

group.name: properties
group.string: The initial text for the text box.
A tip to display when the text box is empty.
Display this text when hovering the mouse over the control.
Choose whether the text box is visible on startup.
Choose whether the text box is enabled or disabled on startup.
Choose whether the text box is read-only on startup.
Allow the browser to spell-check the text box, if supported.
The kind of text entered in to the text box, which also affects on-screen keyboards on touch devices.

group.name: cnds
group.string: Compare the text currently entered in to the text box.
The text to compare the text box's text to.
Choose whether the comparison is case sensitive (FOO different to Foo) or case insensitive (FOO same as Foo).
Triggered when the text in the text box changes.
Triggered when the text box is clicked.
Triggered when the text box is double-clicked.

group.name: acts
group.string: The text to set in the text box.
The tooltip to set on the text box.

Disable or enable the text box.
Choose whether to enable or disable the text box.
Choose whether to enable or disable read-only mode.
Set the input focus to the text box.

group.name: TiledBg
group.string: Automatically tile an image over an area. Tiled Backgrounds are much faster than tiling Sprites.

group.string: Click to edit the object's image.
Choose whether the object is visible when the layout starts.

(none)|Additive|XOR|Copy|Destination over|Source in|Destination in|Source out|Destination out|Source atop|Destination atop

group.string: Set the rendering effect of this object.

group.name: Touch
group.string: Retrieve input from touchscreen devices, and access device orientation and motion.

group.name: properties
group.string: Use mouse clicks as single-touch input (useful for testing).

group.name: cnds
group.string: Triggered when a touch input begins.
Triggered when a touch input ends.
True if between a touch start and touch end.
Triggered when an object is touched.
Choose the object to check for touch.
Test if in a touch and the touch point is over an object.
Choose the object to check for being touched.
True if the device supports orientation detection.
True if the device supports motion detection.

group.name: exps
group.string: Get the touch X co-ordinate in the layout.
Get the touch Y co-ordinate in the layout.
Get the touch X co-ordinate on the canvas.
Get the touch Y co-ordinate on the canvas.
The device compass direction, in degrees.
The device front-to-back tilt, in degrees (front is positive).
The device left-to-right tilt, in degrees (right is positive).
The device X acceleration with gravity, in m/s^2.
The device Y acceleration with gravity, in m/s^2.
The device Z acceleration with gravity, in m/s^2.
The device X acceleration without gravity (if supported), in m/s^2.
The device Y acceleration without gravity (if supported), in m/s^2.
The device Z acceleration without gravity (if supported), in m/s^2.

group.name: WebStorage
group.string: Allows you to store data in the browser session and local storage.

group.name: cnds
group.string: Check if local storage is supported by the browser.
Check if session storage is supported by the browser.
Check if a key exists in local storage.
Enter the name of the key to check.
Check if a key exists in session storage.
Enter the name of the key to check.

group.name: acts
group.string: Store a value in local storage (available in any session).
Enter the name of the key to associate the value with.
Store a value in session storage (only available in the current session).
Enter the name of the key to associate the value with.
Remove a key from local storage.
Enter the name of the key to remove.
Remove a key from session storage.
Enter the name of the key to remove.

group.name: exps
group.string: Get the value from a key in local storage.
Get the value from a key in session storage.
Get the number of keys in local storage.
Get the number of keys in session storage.
Get the value stored in the Nth local key.
Get the value stored in the Nth session key.
Get the Nth local key's name.
Get the Nth session key's name.

group.name: cnds
group.string: Test if caching has been enabled for this application.
Test if pushMobi has been enabled for this application.
Test if streaming has been enabled for this application.
Test if Live Update has been enabled for this application.
Test the current orientation of the device.
Select the orientation to compare to.
Test the initial orientation of the device.
Select the initial orientation to compare to.
Triggered when the user closes a site opened with 'Show remote site'.
Triggered when remote data requested with 'Get remote data' is received.
Triggered when the 'back' button (if any) is pressed after adding a virtual page.

group.name: acts
group.string: Force a remote site opened with 'Show remote site' to close.
The method to use for the request. This parameter should be either "GET" or "POST". Default is "GET".
Post data for a "POST" method request in name=value format separated by ampersands
ID that correlates the request to the event
This method will hide the application splash screen earlier than it automatically does.
Immediately install a waiting Live Update. Following the install, the application will restart itself with the new code. If no update is waiting, this command is ignored.
This function will open a URL in the device's native browser application.
Call this command from within a new web view created by the showRemoteSite or showRemoteSiteExt command to execute JavaScript commands within the main web view.
Open a full-scren QR code reader.
Set whether the device should automatically rotate when changing device orientation.
Whether the device should automatically handle rotation or not.
Lock the orientation of the device to portrait or landscape.
Query the device to determine its current connection to the internet.
Show remote site {0} (close icon {1}x{2} at ({3}, {4}) in portrait, ({5}, {6}) in landscape)
Show a remote web site in a new web view. Touching the close icon will shut down the web view and return the user to the application.
The width of the button to close the web view, in pixels.
The height of the button to close the web view, in pixels.
The position of the button to close the web view from the left edge in pixels when the device is in the portrait orientation.
The position of the button to close the web view from the top edge in pixels when the device is in the portrait orientation.
The position of the button to close the web view from the left edge in pixels when the device is in the Landscape orientation.
The position of the button to close the web view from the top edge in pixels when the device is in the Landscape orientation.
Log an event for statMobi Analytics.
The name of the event you wish to record.
Data for the tracked statMobi event in name=value format separated by ampersands (e.g. "foo=5&bar=10").
This command will get a file from the Internet and cache it locally on the device.
The url of the file to cache.
This method will clear all data stored using the 'Set cookie' action.
Remove all files from the local cache on the device.
This method will clear data previously saved using the setCookie method.
The name of the data to remove.
Remove a file from the local cache on the device.
The url of the file to remove from the local cache.
Save a string in a cookie that can persist between sessions.
The name for the data to set. Must not contain periods or underscores.
A string to save in the cookie.
The number of days the cookie will last before being removed. -1 indicates "never".
Add a virtual page, allowing the next press of the 'back' button (if present) to be intercepted.
Remove a virtual page, reverting the 'back' button to its default action.

group.name: exps
group.string: The version of the appMobi container software that the application is using.
The best type of internet connection available ("wifi", "cell" or "none").
The initial orientation of the device (0, -90, 90 or 180).
The NetStationID or ShoutcastURL of the station that is currently playing.
The model of the device that the application is running on, e.g. "iPhone 4" or "Motorola Droid".
The current orientation of the device (0, -90, 90 or 180).
The device’s current operating system version information.
This property returns the version of phonegap running below the AppMobi layer.
A string identifying the platform that appMobi is running on, e.g. "iOS" or "Android".
Returns any query string parameters passed along with a protocol handler call to start an application.
The response data from 'Get Remote Data'.
Retrieve a string saved with the 'Set Cookie' action.
The name of the cookie to retrieve.
Return a local URL for a cached media file.
URL of the resource to retrieve.

group.name: gamepad
group.string: Receive input from a gamepad device, e.g. console controllers. (BETA - not yet widely supported)

group.name: properties
group.string: Analog stick values (0-100) below this range are returned as zero to smooth the input.

group.name: cnds
group.string: Triggered when a gamepad device is connected to the computer.
Triggered when a gamepad device is disconnected from the computer.
Test if a gamepad button is currently held down.

Choose a gamepad button to test.
Test if any gamepad is connected and active.
Test the value of one of the gamepad's axes.
Enter the zero-based index of the gamepad to test.
Select the gamepad axis to test.
How to select the axis value (ranging from -100 to 100).
The value to compare to, from -100 to 100.

group.name: exps
group.string: The number of currently connected and active gamepads.
A string identifying the gamepad, e.g. manufacturer and model.
Return raw button input from 0 to 100 for a button index.
Return raw axis input from -100 to 100 for an axis index.
Return number of buttons in raw input.
Return number of axes in raw input.
Return button input from 0 to 100 for a button index.
Return axis input from -100 to 100 for an axis index.

group.name: Anchor
group.string: Position objects relative to the size of the window.

group.name: properties
group.string: Anchor the object's left edge to a window edge.
Anchor the object's top edge to a window edge.

group.name: Bullet
group.string: Move an object ahead at its current angle. Typically used for bullets and projectiles.

group.name: properties
group.string: The speed, in pixels per second, the object travels at.
The rate of acceleration, in pixels per second per second. Negative values decelerate.
Gravity on the bullet, in pixels per second per second.
Make the object bounce off solid objects when it collides with them.
Set the object's angle to the angle of motion.

group.string: Compare the current speed of the object.

The new acceleration caused by gravity, in pixels per second per second.
Set {my} angle of motion to [i]{0}[/i] degrees
Set the angle the object is moving at.
The new angle of motion, in degrees.
Bounce the object off an object it is currently touching.
Set whether this behavior is enabled.
Set whether to enable or disable the behavior.

group.name: exps
group.string: The current object speed, in pixels per second.
The acceleration setting, in pixels per second per second.
The angle the object is currently moving at, in degrees.

group.name: Car
group.string: Moves an object forwards with steering.

group.name: properties
group.string: The maximum speed, in pixels per second, the object can travel at.
The rate of acceleration, in pixels per second per second.

The turn speed, in degrees per second.
The rate the angle of motion catches up with the object angle. Lower values cause drifting, higher values cause tighter turns.
The amount of slowdown when hitting solids, between 0 and 1.
Set the object's angle while moving.
If enabled, arrow keys control movement. Otherwise, use the 'simulate control' action.

group.name: cnds
group.string: True when the object is moving.
Compare the current speed of the object.

The new acceleration of the object to set, in pixels per second per second.
The new deceleration of the object to set, in pixels per second per second.
The movement control to simulate pressing.
Set whether this behavior is enabled.
Set whether to enable or disable the behavior.
Set the steer speed of the movement.
The turn speed, in degrees per second.
Set the drift recover rate of the movement.
The rate the angle of motion catches up with the object angle. Lower values cause drifting, higher values cause tighter turns.

The amount of slowdown when hitting solids, between 0 and 1.

group.name: Physics

group.name: properties
group.string: Enable to make object have infinite mass. Ideal for scenery.
How the object collides in the physics simulation.
Prevent the object rotating when hit.
The object friction coefficient, between 0 and 1.
The object elasticity (restitution or 'bounciness') coefficient, between 0 and 1.
Coefficient to slow down motion over time, between 0 and 1.
Coefficient to slow down rotations over time, between 0 and 1.

group.name: acts
group.string: Apply a force on the object.
The name or number of the image point to apply the force at, or 0 for object's origin.
Apply {my} force {0} toward ([i]{1}[/i], [i]{2}[/i]) at image point {3}
Apply a force on the object towards a position in the layout.
The X co-ordinate to apply the force towards.
The Y co-ordinate to apply the force towards.
The name or number of the image point to apply the force at, or 0 for object's origin.
Apply {my} force {0} at angle {1} at image point {2}
Apply a force on the object in a particular direction.
The angle, in degrees, to apply the force towards.
The name or number of the image point to apply the force at, or 0 for object's origin.
Apply an impulse to the object, as if it were suddenly struck.
The name or number of the image point to apply the impulse at, or 0 for object's origin.
Apply {my} impulse {0} toward ([i]{1}[/i], [i]{2}[/i]) at image point {3}
Apply an impulse on the object as if it were suddenly struck towards a position in the layout.
The X co-ordinate to apply the impulse towards.
The Y co-ordinate to apply the impulse towards.
The name or number of the image point to apply the impulse at, or 0 for object's origin.
Apply {my} impulse {0} at angle {1} at image point {2}
Apply an impulse on the object as if it were suddenly struck at an angle.
The angle, in degrees, to apply the impulse at.
The name or number of the image point to apply the impulse at, or 0 for object's origin.
The torque to apply to the object.
Apply a torque towards an angle.
The magnitude of the torque to apply.
The angle, in degrees, to apply torque towards.
Apply a torque towards a position in the layout.
The magnitude of the torque to apply.
The X co-ordinate in the layout to apply torque towards.
The Y co-ordinate in the layout to apply torque towards.
Set the rate the object rotates at.
The angular velocity to set, in degrees per second.
Create {my} distance joint from image point {0} to {1} image point {2}, damping ratio {3}, frequency {4}
Force this and another object to stay a fixed distance apart, as if connected by a pole.
Name or number of image point on this object to attach joint to.
Name or number of image point on other object to attach joint to.
The joint damping ratio, from 0 (no damping) to 1 (critical damping)
Create {my} revolute joint at image point {0} to {1}
Hinge another object to a point on this object.
Name or number of image point on this object to hinge object to.
Set the force of gravity on all objects in the world.
The new force of gravity to set.
Set the way the physics engine steps the simulation.
The stepping mode. 'Fixed' guarantees same results every time but is not framerate independent; 'framerate independent' adjusts to the framerate but may give different results each time.
Set {my} world stepping to {0} velocity iterations and {1} position iterations
Iterations for the velocity constraint solver. Lower is fast and inaccurate, higher is slow and accurate.
Iterations for the position constraint solver. Lower is fast and inaccurate, higher is slow and accurate.
Set the current motion of the physics object.
The X component of the velocity to set, in pixels per second.
The Y component of the velocity to set, in pixels per second.
Set the density of the physics object.
The new object density. Only has effect when 'Immovable' is 'No'.
The new object friction coefficient, between 0 and 1.
The new object elasticity (restitution or 'bounciness') coefficient, between 0 and 1.
Set the coefficient to slow down motion over time.
The new object linear damping, between 0 and 1.
Set the coefficient to slow down rotations over time.
The new object angular damping, between 0 and 1.
Set whether the object has infinite mass (immovable)
Set whether the object has infinite mass (immovable).
Create {my} limited revolute joint at image point {0} to {1}, from {2} to {3} degrees
Hinge another object to a point on this object and limit the range of rotation.
Name or number of image point on this object to hinge object to.
The lower angle of rotation allowed, in degrees.
The upper angle of rotation allowed, in degrees.
Enable or disable collisions with another object using the Physics behavior.
Choose another object type with the Physics behavior to enable or disable collisions for.
Enable or disable collisions with the given object type.

group.name: exps
group.string: The X component of the object's current velocity, in pixels per second.
The Y component of the object's current velocity, in pixels per second.
The object's current angular velocity, in degrees per second.
The object's physics mass, which is its collision area multiplied by its density.
The X co-ordinate of the object's center of mass.
The Y co-ordinate of the object's center of mass.
The current density of the physics object.
The current friction of the physics object.
The current elasticity ('bounciness') of the physics object.

group.name: Pin
group.string: Stick to another object maintaining a relative distance and angle.

group.name: cnds
group.string: Object is currently pinned to another object.

group.name: acts
group.string: Pin the object to another object.
Choose the object to pin to.

group.name: Platform
group.string: Jump and run between platforms (solid objects).

group.name: properties
group.string: The maximum speed, in pixels per second, the object can accelerate to.
The rate of acceleration, in pixels per second per second.
The rate of deceleration, in pixels per second per second.
Speed at which jumps start, in pixels per second.
Acceleration from gravity, in pixels per second per second.
Maximum speed object can reach in freefall, in pixels per second.
If enabled, arrow keys control movement. Otherwise, use the 'simulate control' action.

group.name: cnds
group.string: True when the object is moving.
Compare the current speed of the object.
Choose the way to compare the current speed.
The speed, in pixels per second, to compare the current speed to.
True when the object is on top of a solid or platform.
True when the object is moving upwards (i.e. jumping).
True when the object is moving downwards (i.e. falling).
Triggered when first hitting the floor.
Test if the object has a wall to the left or right.
Select the side to test for a wall.

group.name: acts
group.string: Set whether to ignore the controls for this movement.
Set whether to ignore the controls for this movement.
The new maximum speed of the object to set, in pixels per second.
The new acceleration of the object to set, in pixels per second per second.
The new deceleration of the object to set, in pixels per second per second.
The new speed at which jumps start, in pixels per second.
The new acceleration from gravity, in pixels per second per second.
Set the object's maximum fall speed.
The new maximum speed object can reach in freefall, in pixels per second.
The movement control to simulate pressing.
Set the X component of motion.
The new horizontal movement vector, in pixels per second.
Set the Y component of motion.
The new vertical movement vector, in pixels per second.
Set {my} angle of gravity to [i]{0}[/i] degrees
Change the angle the player falls at.
The angle of gravity in degrees.
Set whether this behavior is enabled.
Set whether to enable or disable the behavior.

group.name: exps
group.string: The current object speed, in pixels per second.
The maximum speed setting, in pixels per second.
The acceleration setting, in pixels per second per second.
The deceleration setting, in pixels per second per second.
The jump strength setting, in pixels per second.
The gravity setting, in pixels per second per second.
The maximum fall speed setting, in pixels per second.
The current angle of motion, in degrees.
The current X component of motion, in pixels.
The current Y component of motion, in pixels.

group.name: properties
group.string: The rotation speed, in degrees per second. Positive is clockwise and negative is anticlockwise.
Rotation acceleration in degrees per second per second (negative slows down).

group.name: acts
group.string: Set {my} speed to {0} degrees per second
Set the rate the object spins at.
The new rotation speed, in degrees per second.
Set {my} acceleration to {0} degrees per second per second
Set the rate the object's spinning changes.
The new rotation acceleration, in degrees per second per second.

group.name: exps
group.string: The current rotation speed in degrees per second.
The current rotation acceleration in degrees per second per second.

group.name: Sin
group.string: Adjust an object's position, size or angle with an oscillating sine wave.

group.name: properties
group.string: Enable the behavior at the beginning of the layout.
Select what property of the object to modify.
The time in seconds for a complete cycle.
Add a random number of seconds to the period, up to this value.
The initital time in seconds through the cycle.
Add a random number of seconds to the initial time, up to this value.
The maximum change in pixels (or degrees for Angle).
Add a random number to the magnitude, up to this value.

group.name: cnds
group.string: True if the movement is currently active.

group.name: acts
group.string: Set whether the movement is active or inactive.
Set the time in seconds for a complete cycle.
The time in seconds for a complete cycle.
Set the magnitude of the movement.
The maximum change in pixels (or degrees for Angle).

group.name: exps
group.string: Return the current position in the cycle as a number from 0 to 1.
Return the current period, in seconds.
Return the current magnitude of the movement.

group.name: bound
group.string: Stop an object leaving the layout.

group.name: properties
group.string: Choose whether to stop the object at its origin or at its edge.

group.name: custom
group.string: Make your own movement using low-level movement functions.

group.name: properties
group.string: Move in increments while firing the step triggers.
When stepping enabled, the number of pixels to move each step.

group.name: cnds
group.string: True when the object is moving.
Compare the current speed of the object.
Choose the way to compare the speed.
The speed, in pixels per second, to compare to.
Triggered when stepping the object for motion.
Triggered when stepping the object horizontally for motion.
Triggered when stepping the object vertically for motion.

group.name: acts
group.string: Choose which axes to reverse on.
The new speed of the object to set, in pixels per second.
Accelerate the object forwards or on an axis.
The acceleration, in pixels per second per second.
Accelerate the object at an angle.
The acceleration, in pixels per second per second.
The angle, in degrees, to accelerate toward.
Accelerate the object toward a position.
The acceleration, in pixels per second per second.
The X co-ordinate in the layout to accelerate toward.
The Y co-ordinate in the layout to accelerate toward.
The new angle of motion, in degrees.
Rotate {my} angle of motion clockwise [i]{0}[/i] degrees
Rotate the angle of motion in a clockwise direction.
Amount to rotate clockwise, in degrees.
Rotate {my} angle of motion counter-clockwise [i]{0}[/i] degrees
Rotate the angle of motion in a counter-clockwise direction.
Amount to rotate counter-clockwise, in degrees.
Stop the current stepping, preventing any more step triggers firing this tick.
Push the object to a space if it is overlapping a solid.
Choose the method of push out.
Push {my} out of solid at angle {0}
Push the object to a space at an angle if it is overlapping a solid.
Angle, in degrees, to push the object out at.
Set whether this behavior is enabled.
Set whether to enable or disable the behavior.

group.name: exps
group.string: The current object speed, in pixels per second.
The current angle of motion, in degrees.
The current X component of motion, in pixels per second.
The current Y component of motion, in pixels per second.

group.name: destroy
group.string: Automatically destroy the object if it leaves the layout area.

group.name: jumpthru
group.string: A solid the Platform behavior can also jump on to from underneath.

group.name: acts
group.string: Set whether the object counts as a platform or not.
Set whether the object counts as a platform or not.

group.name: scrollto
group.string: Always center the view on this object, or at the mid-point of multiple objects.

group.name: acts
group.string: Shake the screen for a duration of time.
The strength of the shake, in maximum pixels to scroll away.
The time the shake should last, in seconds.
Select whether the magnitude gradually reduces to zero over the duration, or stays constant.

group.name: solid
group.string: Make the object impassable, so other objects cannot move or fall through it.

group.name: acts
group.string: Set whether the object counts as solid or not.
Set whether the object counts as solid or not.

group.name: wrap
group.string: Make an object leaving the layout reappear on the other side.
